document_data.caption: The Ring ''circa'' [[1372 DR]]
document_data.name: Ring of Blue Fire
document_data.mainbody: The '''Ring of Blue Fire''', previously known as the '''Ring of Gray Flames''', that dated back to the ancient empire of [[Raumathar]].
document_data.Description:
The five towers of the ring were set in a circular arrangement each of which was topped with corona of gray flame. Each of the remaining towers emitted strange mechanical sounds and radiated strong magical auras that disrupted the casting of any form of [[divine magic]] within a {{SI|100|ft}} radius.

As of the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], the continual gray flames were transformed into jets of [[blue fire]] that erupted sporadically, accompanied by a bright light that shone from within the towers.
document_data.Geography: The towers were located on the edge of the [[Endless Wastes]], about three day's of travel by [[horse]]back east of [[Mulptan]].
document_data.History:
By the {{YearlinkName|1372}}, only two of the five towers remained whole and standing. 

At some point during or before the {{YearlinkName|1374}}, someone recovered the powerful ''[[belt of Raumathar]]'' from the ruins.<ref name=NWN2.MotB">

During the [[Spellplague]], in the {{YearlinkName|1385}}, the flames erupting from the towers became more intense and changed from their gray color to that of the [[blue fire]] associated with the cataclysmic event. They took on the same transformative properties as the blue fire, causing nearby creatures to develop [[spellscar]]s or even transform into [[plaguechanged]] horrors.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: Many people believed that the towers were a source of ancient [[Raumathari battlemage|Raumathari battle magic]].
document_data.Inhabitants: The lands surrounding the towers were inhabited by [[living spell|roaming spells]] that seemed to have a mind and will of their own.
